name: The Edgewater

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms #1 & #2 have a view overlooking the harbor. You must understand that you're two doors from a Karaoke bar that closes around midnight on Fri/Sat night.
reviews.title: A gem on Catalina Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a Gem in the middle of the tourist area of Catalina. You're easy walking from any/everything.
reviews.title: Great place for half the Cost!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010
reviews.text: It was my boyfriend's 21st birthday so I wanted to do something really special, which was taking him to catalina for a night. I looked up hotel after hotel for 2-3 days before setteling on the Vista Del Mar as my first choice with the Snug Harbor Inn as my second. When I called to make the appointment the womon on the other end had told me that all the hotels on the island we requireing a 2-3 night minimum stay because of the Jazz Festival that was being theld hat weekend. She then gave me the number to The Edgewater because she knew it was a hotel that allowed for a one night stay.
reviews.title: Great location in the heart of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had run across The Edgewater during my research but because the pictures of the room weren't that thorough on their website I found it a little iffy, but when it became the only hotel that would accept my one night stay I had no choice but to book them. I'm very glad I did!! I booked the Ocean View Suite which cost about half the prices of what the other hotels on the island were asking. They are VERY reasonable! Because the hotel only had eight rooms I imagined their suite would be a little smaller than normal, which it was, but it was a perfect size for me and my boyfriend! They even decorated the room a little because I told them it was my boyfriends 21st, which was very nice of them.
reviews.title: Upscale Look with a Homey Attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had room number 1 which actually was an ajoining room to room number 2, the only other Ocean View Suite at the hotel. If they talked loud enough, you could actually somewhat hear the other people in the other suite next to you. But that was only if you really tried to focus on what they were saying is if you noticed them. Other than that you didn't notice them. My boyfriend also noticed a continious beeping in our room which we later found out was possibly coming from the smoke alarm. I never really noticed it, but for the first couple hours is bugged my boyfriend, but then he to didn't notice it after a while. The hotel felt very safe too! When the woman gave us our hotel key there were two keys, one for our room, and one for the front door which they lock at night so no unexpected visitors can be walking up and down the halls. The bathroom was amazing! I loved the color of the tile and it seemed to have an older elegant feel to it. It was very modern and very clean! Very nice room. I would definetely recommend this hotel! For his birthday, my boyfriend loved it!
reviews.title: Would Stay Here Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I researched for weeks before deciding on the Edgewater. With June-Sept being the busiest time in Catalina, most places require a two night minimum. Not the Edgewater! The innkeep was very accomodating, even being nice enough to reschedule our stay last minute due to a family emergency. I told her our stay was for my husband's Birthday and the room had a few balloons in it, nice touch!
reviews.title: Comparatively good value in the center of boardwalk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I must say that when I began my research I was really discouraged with the value to price ratio in Catalina. Many of these inns and hotels are very expensive for an old musty room, dingy looking beds and bathrooms with no extra accomodations Obviously, this has to do with the supply and demand on such a little city, and for the most part in Avalon, I assume most people spend their time outdoors anyway. I was skeptical about the Edgewater because it seemed too good to be true; a lower price per night than it's competitors; dead-center of the boardwalk location and nice, modern looking rooms. We were very pleasantly suprised that the rooms were just as pictured and very comfortable. The hotel itself is simply an upstairs floor above a tourist shop below. A long hallway that has about 14 rooms, a kitchen alcove, an office and a sitting porch at the end of the hall, that's it! It was all we needed and I'm pleased at our decision, given the chance to come to Avalon again, we'll most likely stay at the Edgewater.
reviews.title: Perfect Girls Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was the perfect girls weekend. Besides having the most amazing location in Avalon , The Edgewater was the perfect place for me and my friends to stay. We knew from the minute we arrived that we were going to have the time of our lives. The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and informative. The rooms were so much bigger than we had expected. They were furnished nicely and with so much light. You could tell the hotel had been recently renovated,. It has so much style and also very quaint . In the evening we relaxed and had wine on the roof top deck while we sat by the firepit. It was clean and the beds very comfortable. We enjoyed a delicious continental breakfast before we went for a ride on the zip line. It was the perfect weekend and we will definitely be back to The Edgewater.
reviews.title: My experience was a dream come true!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This 8 room hotel has retained the charm of its 1920's origin but has recently been thoroughly updated with all modern conveniences. The decor is definitely upscale. I loved the contrast of the while linens against the dark wood of the furnishings. The white down comforters were very luxurious. I liked that the linens were white because you could tell how clean they were (unlike some hotels that have darker colored print bedspreads). Although I did have a peak at the outstanding ocean view rooms, I was very happy to stay in one of the rooms that had both a queen size bed and a twin bed. The room was perfect for my friend and myself. I also liked that there was a back patio where one could relax in the sun or shade as well as a small sitting room at the front of the hotel. In addition, it was great that there was a refrigerator available to the guests if one needed to refrigerate some food taken from a restaurant, etc. All in all, this was a dream come true and I hope to come back soon!
reviews.title: A gorgeous hotel with a spectacular view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the beautiful Edgewater Hotel in the heart of Avalon on Catalina Island. It was the best location possible, right on Crescent Street across from the beach and close to the pier. It had the most spectacular view from the room. I think it must be the best view in Catalina. You could watch the people go by and see the beautiful harbor. It was so centrally located we could walk to dinner both nights at great restaurants only a couple of doors down. There was a nice souvenir shop downstairs. We could walk to the Casino and to the shops. One couldn't ask for a better location. The lady was so helpful to us, telling us great places to go, and giving us interesting information about the island when we asked. She was so accommodating. The hotel had a little sitting room with information in it, and an area with snacks and coffee. It was furnished beautifully. Lovely photographs lined the walls. The room was very nice with comfortable beds with fluffy duvets. There were extra nice touches. Mints on the bedside tables. Big screen TVs. Very clean rooms. Nice amenities in the bathroom. An air conditioner that worked great. And information about Catalina in the room. There was even an outside area with lounging chairs if you cared to get some sun. We had a perfectly lovely experience at this hotel and I recommend it highly.
reviews.title: Family hotel, families not welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hey, just got back from this cool hotel. Fantastic view, across from the beach and harbor. Nice family people. big screen TVs, internet and included kitchen with breakfast. VERY CLEAN --- BL Ps Going back soon.
reviews.title: Great Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our weekend could not have been better--thanks to the amazing views, beautiful decor, comfortable beds and the warm hospitality that the Brisacher family provided. We discovered the family has owned and operated The Edgewater for four generations since 1922. The Edgewater recently was remodeled and all furnishings are topnotch. A nice bonus is that a continental breakfast is included and the kitchen is also handy for making coffee or tea in the evening. Barbara and Brittani couldn't have been nicer and was quick to recommend island activities and restaurants. We can't wait to go back soon and highly recommend The Edgewater!
reviews.title: Spectacular view and wonderful hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009
reviews.text: I love the hotel and the hosts are amazing and the rooms were awsome and it was a perfect getway
reviews.title: Fanatic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family loved the convenient acccess to the Edgewater Hotel, as it was only a short walk from the Catalina Flyer, and is located in a terrific, central location right on the main street of Avalon. We enjoyed walking and hiking from the hotel, with no need for other transportation. We were right in the center of shopping, restaurants, the beach, pier and harbor as soon as we came down the stairway from the Hotel to the boardwalk. The famous Casino was only a short walk, and the Botanic Gardens and Wrigley Memorial were a beautiful, easy hike from the Hotel. It was fun to be in the center of the action, and then go up the stairs to a serene and extremely comfortable environment. The view of the stunnng Harbor from the front rooms of the Hotel is magnificent. The retreat areas, elegant decor, and fountains outside some of the rooms added to the pleasant and relaxing feel. I especially loved the stunning photographs, by the talented Brittani Brisacher, that grace the hallway, showing different scenes of the Island. The continental breakfast and kitchen area certainly added to our convenience and comfort, as we had access to them during the whole stay. The friendly staff were available to give us suggestions and answer questions about activities on the Island, and their pride in their Hotel and the Island were evident. What a great place to be in an Island paradise so close to the mainland!
reviews.title: Paradise in Avalon can be Enjoyed only 26 miles from the Mainland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at many beachfront hotels, but none capture the beauty, relaxed atmosphere, and convenience that this hotel offers. The hotel is family owned and operated, and they are all very friendly and helpful. There is a magnificent view of the harbor, and you are in walking to distance to all the bars, restaurants, and leisure activities that you desire. It has recently been remodeled, and the place is beautiful. The room was exceptionally clean and quiet. We can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Best beach front hotel I have been to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was pretty nervous about this hotel for some reason. I would call to ask questions and it would be hours before anyone would return the call. I now know why. They dont have anyone on-site most of the time. This is not a problem unless you have a question/problem.
reviews.title: Cozy hotel in a Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: It is a very small place. I think there are 8 rooms. 2 are ocean view rooms, which are larger than the others. We didnt stay in one of them, we had a normal room. It was a TINY room, barely enough room to walk. The decor was nice. Furniture was updated and clean. Bedding was nice. The bed itself was not very comfortable, but I like firmer mattresses. It felt a little claustrophobic in the room. The window opened up into a little patioish area. Cant go out there, it had a fountain, and our window looked right into the room next to us (maybe 3 feet from us), which was a little weird. We just kept our curtains closed. The bathroom was old, everything worked, but it could definitely use some updating. No counterspace to speak of.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice flat screen mounted on wall above the desk. Free wireless internet. There was a small kitchen area that was shared by all guests. They had juice, fruit and coffee avail. Well, on our last day the maid forgot to put new coffee in - and we couldn't find the coffee to refill it ourselves. There was a refrigerator that everyone could use, and a microwave. Nice touch. Everything was clean, but they dont clean your room. We did ask for more towels, but that was the only service we got.
reviews.title: A Charming Little Hotel steps from the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners seem super nice and called to make sure everything was ok. When I spoke to her we had just gotten there, so we didnt have much to say at that time.
reviews.title: perfection for a short get away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I stay there again? Maybe. It wasn't a bad place, room was just so small. I also didnt like the fact that there was no one there. They left a number to call if you need anything, but I didn't want to bug them.
reviews.title: a hidden gem for sure, and yet perfectly situated.

description: Built in 1922, The Edgewater is a boutique hotel located on the historic Santa Catalina Island. This family owned and operated establishment, located in the heart of Avalon, is just steps away from the water’s edge, front street shopping, tours, restaurants and nightlife. Our boutique hotel offers two spacious deluxe Ocean view Suites, which can be connected, and six well-appointed Fountain-view rooms. Each room and suite features complimentary wireless internet, Ortho-pedic ® beds, flat screen TVs, cable television, air conditioning/heat and luxurious down comforters. Our suites provide guests with custom built mini bars and indoor sitting porches that overlook picturesque Avalon Bay. The Edgewater offers kitchen access to guests, which is equipped with a microwave, U-Line ® ice maker, and coffee maker, paired with a selection of coffees and teas. Continental breakfast is set up each morning in the lobby kitchen. During the summer months, complimentary afternoon wine and cheese is available, as well as beach chairs and towels, upon request. The Brisacher family welcomes you to enjoy your stay at The Edgewater!
